newsitem.title: UK: Jan-Oct 1996 world zinc consumption fell-ILZSG. [corrected 16:52 gmt]
newsitem.headline: Jan-Oct 1996 world zinc consumption fell-ILZSG. [corrected 16:52 gmt]

text.p: (Corrects headline to read "...consumption fell" instead of "...consumption rose")

Total world zinc metal consumption fell by 1.1 percent over the first ten months of 1996 to 6.243 million tonnes, against 6.311 million in the same period in 1995, said the International Lead and Zinc Study Group (ILZSG).
World zinc metal production fell by 0.3 percent to 6.061 from 6.080.
World zinc mine output rose by 2.1 percent to 5.864 million from 5.743.
ILZSG estimated total world lead metal consumption in January to October 1996 at 4.724, up 2.5 percent from the 4.611 produced in the same year ago period.
World lead metal production was up 1.4 percent to 4.552, versus 4.488.
World lead mine output rose by 5.2 percent to 2.314, against 2.199.
ILZSG said stocks of refined zinc with Western world producers at the end of October amounted to 285,000 tonnes, a fall of 13,000 tonnes from September.
Stocks of refined lead held by Western producers rose by 28,000 tonnes in October to stand at 175,000 tonnes.
